page.title: 19EDUCATION
page.content: The first school in Roos was called the "Boys School".It was opened prior to 1863.In 1866 girls joined.Then a new building was built on nearby land given by Lady Hotham,who said the school must be called{Roos Church of {England Primary School.}This building, in the centre of the village was begun on 3rd July 1872,and was used for a century.It was then found to be too small with poor facilities and a new modern open-plan school was built in 1981.The pupils and staff moved in on January 4th.1982.The school was built for 90 pupils,but at present the roll is 80.The new school is on the northern outskirts of the main part of the village.It has good facilities including a large playground and playing field.
